pages.title: Large Gears
pages.text: <item>Large Gears/$ are a way of moving <thing>$(l:essentials:intro/rotary)rotary energy/$ around, by connecting to form a system of gears and axles.$(br2)Like <item>$(l:essentials:rotary/gear_base)small gears/$, <item>large gears/$ can connect around corners, on the sides, or on axles on the front or back. Unlike <item>$(l:essentials:rotary/gear_base)small gears/$, <item>large gears/$ can't share a

blockspace with anything else, and are 3x3 in size instead of 1x1. <item>Large gears/$ also don't need a solid surface to be supported on.$(br2)There are several materials for <item>large gears/$ (most of the metals) with different <thing>$(l:essentials:intro/rotary)I values/$.$(br2)Because of their large radius, a <item>large gear/$ next to a <item>$(l:essentials:rotary/gear_base)small gear/$ will spin
at a slower speed than the <item>$(l:essentials:rotary/gear_base)small gear/$.$(br2)
Remember, all gear networks need at least one <item>$(l:essentials:rotary/axis)master axis/$ to work.$(br2)
